Ademir

fields.description: As a manager, I only want issues entered against a version that will actually ship. However, some teams want to have intermediate milestones within a release (such as a sprint or drop) and use that on their Agile boards. I want some ability to define a milestone and use it in addition to the version (like the hierarchy of versions that was available in the Classic board, but not an actual version that would show up in the Version drop down).
fields.summary: Add ability to define intermediate milestones outside of using versions (eg for Sprints, release milestones)

fields.description:
After creating new Global Ranking fields, enabled them for all project and added them in GH Configuration,Still, in the board configuration window I still see only "Ranking: Rank" and no option to edit it.
I am full jira administrator, owner of the board and of the filter used by this board.
I tried to change the filter to use a different Rank custom field, and I was allowed to do. Still, Jira says that GH is using the old field and it does not allow me to change it.
fields.summary: Change the Rank field of a planning board

fields.description:
Hello,

I am the administrator of the account I work on as adussel.
I was working on Green Hopper for Jira, updating issues, and changing their status. Suddenly, my user (adussel) was not allowed anymore to change the issue (I can't reassigned, edit the issues anymore. but I was able do it 10 mn ago !)

Somebody must have change smth in your team about that...

Can you fix this very quickly, I have to work.... :(

Thx !!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The epic name/color are visible in "Plan" view of the Agile Board (scrum version, not sure about kanban), but don't show up on cards when in the "Work" view, only on the "card details" column if I click on a specific issue.

Adding it to the Cards view itself would be really helpful to help us arrange things together visually in our sprints.  At the moment, we're resorting to putting the epic as a prefix of every issue summary.
fields.summary: Show epic on cards in "work" view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-2268?focusedCommentId=490664&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-490664

[~njm] wrote:
Do you know of a way to JQL search for something that was flagged?
For instance, a Kanban team may use the flag on an issue (or several over time) and then want to look at their cycle time while excluding issues that were ever flagged. We can exclude the currently flagged issues with Flagged ~= Impediment.
Unfortunately Flagged WAS "Impediment" does not work as it is a 'Multi Checkboxes' custom field and they do not support WAS JQL (nor does the CHANGED clause).
fields.summary: As a user I would like to search for historically flagged issues using JQL

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the Agile planning Version and I think Component hierarchies can be set up but there isn't really a simple way to do it when initially creating things.  This help a lot when organizing a project, especially components as well as Issues for Epic->Story relationships
fields.summary: It would be great to be able to easily create heirarchies of Issues, Components and Versions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would like to see multiple avatars for a Story in the Greenhopper Scrum Board's Work view.

In the current Work view, when we Pair Program on a story, there is no visibility of the second person in the pair.

Can GH be enhanced so that while a Story is still assigned to a single person, you can add the Pair Programmer to another field and have both avatars show in the Work view?

(At present, we need to use a physical wall to employ this feature.)
fields.summary: As a GH User, I would like to see Avatars for everyone working on the story

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to our documentation on [Ending a Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ending+a+Sprint]:

{quote}
Any issues not completed at the end of the sprint will be returned to the backlog (or to the next planned sprint, if you have one) as they did not meet the team's definition of "Done".
{quote}

That's actually not working. Even having planned sprints, not completed issues are returned to the backlog.

Is there any adittional configuration that needs to be set to get not completed to be placed on the planned sprints instead of the backlog?

Tested on OnDemand 6.1-OD-02, Greenhopper 6.2.3
fields.summary: Ending a Sprint documentation is not worked as documented

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the agile board "Report" view, the sprint selector overlay window does not scroll on many items in list. This leads to an inability to select the sprint for reporting, since the window has no scroll bar. The maximum amount of sprints shown is limited by the screen height of the window...
fields.summary: Sprint selection overlay window does not scroll on many items in list (prohibiting selection of sprint for report)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be great to able to view commit data in the Agile issue detail pane (perhaps with the comments or as a new tab), rather than having to leave the Agile view and go to the Issue Detail page.

Please see the attached screenshot, the commits show up in the detail pane but only provide the name of the commiter and nothing else
fields.summary: Show commits in Agile issue detail pane - regression

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be nice if the gadgets (burndown gadget and days remaining gadget) would link back to the boards.

We are using these gadgets to create one dashboard to show information about all teams in our development department. Having a link to the board there would make it so much easier to find detail information about the sprint of one team.

My suggestion would be to make the Board name link to the planning board of the team, and the Sprint name to the sprint report of that sprint.
fields.summary: Make board name in gadgets link to boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Greenhopper saved filter failed to edit or search any filters when JIRA integrated with LDAP.

The problem is reproducible when the following criteria's are met:
* Filters contain LDAP assignee or inactive LDAP user.
* LDAP user is the board owner.
* The user try to edit the saved filter.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Setup a new JIRA 5.2.11 and integrate it with LDAP.
# Sync all the crowd users.
# Used LDAP user with *JIRA System Administrator* permission to create new issues (assign to LDAP user), filters, projects and boards.
# Create more than four filters with LDAP user assignee or reporters.
# Then, try to edit the *Saved Filter* from *Board Configuration* instead of choosing the list in combo box.
# The following error is shown.
{noformat}
An error occurredHide…
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'value' of undefined
Resource: http://localhost:8082/jira/s/en_US-chbjjj-418945332/854/3/67d29b773627b253cf0afdfc7082bdce/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid-config,atl.general/batch.js
Line: 4691
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/27.0.1453.116 Safari/537.36
{noformat}

As a possible *workaround solution*, please upgrade the Greenhopper to *6.2.5 or later*.
fields.summary: Saved Filter not editable after JIRA integrate with LDAP

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-9418].
  {panel}

Repro:
1. Create a new sprint
2. Create a story with a subtask and add to the sprint
3. Start the sprint
4. DON'T COMPLETE THE STORY
5. In work mode, try to complete the sprint

Expected: completes and puts issues back into backlog

Actual: Error saying cannot complete due to incomplete subtasks

This works fine in JIRA 6.0 and below. If you have incomplete stories with incomplete subtasks you can complete the sprint. 

(complete stories with incomplete subtasks is expected behaviour but this is different)
fields.summary: JIRA 6.1: cannot complete sprint with open subtasks on open issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Sprint burndown gadget is wasting a lot of space if displayed with 2- or 3-column layout. see screenshot.

This issue makes it impossible to show information from multiple teams on one Dashboard. It would be nice to have the possibility to provide information from 9 teams in a 3x3 grid.
fields.summary: Sprint burndown gadget is wasting a lot of space

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Sprint Burndown Gadget can be configured to "Show board name", which is very helpful if you have multiple teams and want to create a dashboard to show information about all teams.

If there is no active sprint for a team there will only be a message "There are no active sprints", but the board name is not displayed anymore. This makes it difficult to see at a glance which team this gadget belongs to, see screenshot. This is especially confusing if you configure a wallboard to slide through the boards. In that case users can only see "There are no active sprints" for a few seconds which might be missunderstood as that there are no active sprints at all.

The gadget should show the board name in addition to the "There are no active sprints" error message.

This is also true for the "Remaining days" gadget.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown Gadget should display board name even if there is no sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On Greenhopper in 'Plan' mode when a Story has sub tasks it lists the count of sub tasks next to the name of the story.

It would be useful if this also listed the 'points' for the story.
fields.summary: Work mode to include points as well as sub-task count

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Putting issues from other projects under an epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In an effort to try and reduce the amount of cogs in the top right corner of the screen, we should change the cog dropdown to be a simple AUI dropdown button, as seen here: https://developer.atlassian.com/design/buttons.html

The text for the button should read "Board" and the rest of the entries will remain as they are.
fields.summary: Change board configuration from a subtle button with an icon (cog) to be a simple dropdown button

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently closed issues are just crossed out by the number of the issue.
This is quite hard to see in one view, which ones are really closed or not.

The closed issues should be marked by using user styles for highlighting.
E.g. cross out complete text and set the background to green etc.

If this is not already possible in the current version, please integrate that possibility to the future release of jira.

Thank you
fields.summary: Jira: Closed Issues should be formated in User style (for one quick overview)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Following error seen when attempting to drag an issue between columns on the board.

{noformat}
o	Exception: TypeError: A is undefined
o	Resource: http://foo.bar.com/s/en_UK-uu1jxh-418945332/843/36/87a4b5ca79e66377d7481344ca5f0453/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid/batch.js
o	Line: 3481
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:22.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/22.0
{noformat}

The steps to reproduce are as follows:

1) Implement workaround #1 for:

[Unable to set issues to Resolved using Greenhopper Simplified Workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Unable+to+set+issues+to+Resolved+using+Greenhopper+Simplified+Workflow]

Thus, dragging an issue to "Done" now displays a transition screen.

2) When you've dragged an to "Done" so that the screen is displayed, do not submit it.  Press Cancel or Esc.  ie, you've decided that you selected the wrong issue.

3) The issue now displays in a "horizontally truncated" form.

4) Now try to drag any other issue on the board...  you'll get the TypeEror.

There's nothing logged.  And when you see the issue displaying funny (#3 above) you can just refresh the screen and avoid the TypeError.  This is why I have logged as Minor.
fields.summary: Uncaught TypeError After Cancelling Dragging an Issue on Wall

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When adding or editing components on a particular issue/card, a refresh to that page is required before an added component can be added to the list.

Likewise, removed components remain in the list until a page refresh...making it possible to enter orphaned data.

Even though the dropdown for components appears to be AJAX, the data isn't in line with what's current for the project.
fields.summary: Changes to components in project admin requires refresh on card for use

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Starting from a Greenhopper SCRUM planning dashboard:

Click on an issue
Press "e" or click on the JIRA link to bring up the edit issue.
Select an Epic Link of any type.
Select "Save"

Expected Result:
The epic link saved to the issue matches the one selected during the update process.

Actual Result:
The epic link is not the same as what was selected during the update process.
fields.summary: Editing an epic link returns an incorrect epic link.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
A user should be able to choose the maximum value of the Y-axis of the Cumulative Flow Diagram to display for clarity purposes.

A simple but effective use case is this:
# Imagine having a CFD with the following parts: [^Part1.PNG] and [^Part2.PNG]
# In [^Part2.PNG], because of that single line in which the data spikes up, the scale of the Y-Axis stretches up to a very high number. 
# This causes the other parts of the graph to be too small to view properly, as we can see in [^Part1.PNG]. The only workaround is to manually zoom the browser itself.
fields.summary: Y-Axis of Cumulative Flow Diagram should be configurable for clarity purposes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
grouping by epic is powerfull but the estimate shown in the epic summary(expand an epic and you see an estimate value) shows only an estimate field. Trial an error learns this is the total original estimate.

first of all, changing the name to 'original estimate' would make things clear.
Second, this is only is not useful as the remaining work is what counts to see how much work is left.

I worked around it by using the REST Api to get the numbers myself but having this fixed in greenhopper would solve the problem.

Please add a remaining field or change the existing estimate field & change the 'estimate' field to 'original estimate'.
fields.summary: epic summary does show orignal estimate instead of remaining estimate

fields.description: When issues are moved from one project to another, this does not change the issue link used for Classic-mode Epics. As it's possible for JIRA to determine the historical issue key, it would be helpful if Epic labels that do not match an in-use issue key be matched against the issue keys of previously moved issues.

-Queries
-Stories
-Assignees
-No swimlanes

The request is to support 'fix version' and epics as well.
fields.summary: Base swimlanes on fix versions and epics (for kanban) too

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In Greenhopper, under the reports screen you cannot scroll through the list of sprints/epics/versions in the various report pages. If you have more sprints, epics or versions than will fit on screen then you cannot select any value you can't see. 

In the attached screenshot I've reduced the browser window size so it's shorter than required to show all 28 sprints. I can only see Sprints 1-20 in the list so I can't select sprints 21-28 to view the sprint report on them. 

These dropdowns need to have a scrollbar on them to make them usable with large amounts of data.
fields.summary: Cannot see all epics on Epic Report screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Example Case

Steps:
# Click on top issue's link in any swimlane and any column -  Issue Detail View will be shown
# Click on gear icon in Issue Detail View and then click Send to Bottom

Actual result:
- Selected Issue has been sent to bottom
- Now focus is on issue that was next in this swimlane and column. Issue Detail View is showing next issue as well

Desired result:
- Selected Issue has been sent to bottom
- Both focus and Issue Detail View remains on the same issue.
fields.summary: Rapid Board Issue Detail View lose it's focus on current issue after "Send to .."

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We use EPICs to describe and represent big features or scenarios.
It might happen, that the same Story is related (must be implemented) as a part of different scenarios (EPICs).
For transparency and planning  purposes, we need a possibility to link a story to more than one EPIC.

I mean Story belongs to EPIC and NOT just linked via "parent-child" relations 
Thank you
German Sakaryan
fields.summary: As a PO, I want to have possibility to link a User Story to more than one EPIC

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For review with [~bhumphrey@atlassian.com] [~mjopson] [~tkotecki]

On the report page, the dropdown does not scroll with the page. Even with the changes to use the autocomplete control it stays in one place while the chart moves. 

This is because the element containing the options is appended to the body, not the container for the chart controls, which is scrollable separately to the body. 

[~jraoult] looked at the control and we think it can't be fixed to make it scroll, so the best fix would be to stop the chart controls from scrolling. The downside would be less scrollable area on small screens. 

Splitting out from the original story since it's a pretty big task and it's not a regression, so it shouldn't hold up the other story from being tested or going live.
fields.summary: Make the chart area scrollable without the chart controls

!1.jpg|thumbnail!

Besides, the *Greenhopper wallboard gadget* is affected as well:
* !2.jpg|thumbnail!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
With a long list of Epics, the list provided in the Epic Report's dropdown is unwieldy. 

I understand that GHS-8469 will help users to find a *specific* Epic, but for those simply browsing the list it would be great if a user could choose to filter out all completed Epics, or at least sort them - possibly by: 
# Epic Status (In Progress, To Do, Done) then 
# <ranking as per the Plan view>

I've seen this wish expressed in a few [comments | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6949?focusedCommentId=461008&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-461008], but couldn't find an explicit story for it. Cheers.
fields.summary: Hide or Reorder Completed Epics in the Epic Report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
CoS:

* Simple text banner communicating that this release contains migration and that administrators need to be aware of what's happening.
* Link to Upgrade Notes/Migration docs
* Appears on every JIRA page once only
* Appears for every administrator user.
* Needs to stack well with other potential banners that JIRA provides.
* If the user installs GH for the first time and has no boards, or all the boards are already migrated, then we don't want to see this message.

(!) Dev Notes (!)
Q: Does the banner show up for every user, or just admins?
A: (/) Just system et regular admins
Q: Does it show only once, or does it persist?
A: (/) Once

Q: Does it still display if GreenHopper is unlicensed?
A: (/) No

Q: Does it display even with the redirect to Getting Started?
A: (/) Yes

Q: Does it display for anonymous users?
A: (/) No
fields.summary: In order to be better aware of the sprint markers migration, as an administrator I want to see a banner when GH 6.3 is installed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When creating a Sprint, user is given the control to specify the name of the Sprint. And there's no character restriction is applied when specifying the Sprint Name. 

In this case, if we specify a double quote character ("") in the Sprint Name, the name will be displayed in correctly in the Velocity Chart after we completed the Sprint. Please see the following screenshot which illustrates the behavior:
!scshot.png! 
(i) The correct name of the Sprint is {{Sprint "quote" AND "quote" aga}}. Note that the " is replaced by " instead

Steps to reproduce the problem:
- Create a Sprint in GreenHopper Scrum Board, and specify the double quote character in the Sprint name
- Add a couple of issues to the Sprint, and start the Sprint
- Complete the Sprint, go to the Velocity Chart report
fields.summary: Incorrect Sprint name in the Velocity Chart report, if the Sprint name contains double quote character

fields.description: As a user, I would like to be able to Favorite boards. I envision this behavior being similar to favoriting Dashboards in JIRA.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to Favorite boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
You can potentially tell which epic is selected for view in Plan mode by the issues that show up, but that is not always the case. 

In order to more quickly understand which epic is selected, the contrast of the items selected or some type of highlighting of which epic is currently selected would be useful.
fields.summary: Increase contrast of highlighted epic in Plan Mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: GreenHopper's Bulk Change is bypassing the JIRA's 'Bulk Change' global permission

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As described on the summary, custom fields that are included with certain 3rd party plugins cannot be shown on the GreenHopper issue details view. 

It would be great to have this feature on future GreenHopper version.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have customfields from third party plugin to be displayed on the GreenHopper issue details view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Both Stories and Tasks can be flagged through the context menu.

Flagged stories do not show a flag in the work tab when using Story Swimlanes. I would consider this a bug, because you can set/unset the flag using the context menu in the detail view of the work board without any visiual indication that something happend. Additionally the documentation explicitly states that the flags are visible in both planning and work tabs.

Flagged tasks are not visible in the planing board (not even in the sub-issue list in the detail view). It would be nice if it was visible even in the backlog list if an story has flagged tasks.

It would also be nice to see flags in the Sprint report.
fields.summary: Show sub-task flags in Detail View sub-tasks section

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have been using the Greenhopper Classic Hour Brundown Chart for some time, but after upgrading to JIRA 6.0.1 it truncates the Y axis of the chart in wallboard mode. In "normal" mode it displays correctly, see screenshots.
fields.summary: Greenhopper Classic Hour Brundown Chart does not display correctly in Wallboard mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Sometimes, especially when reviewing a sprint board as a team, you want to see specific issues on the Rapid Board.  

One can implement a quick filter for every single scenario, but this can make the quick filter menu quite crowded.

It would be nice to be able to perform a JQL inside the rapid board to quickly see what you're looking for.
fields.summary: Allow one to perform JQL queries on the Rapid Board as a quick filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-9339].
  {panel}

*Description*
The Create Epic dialog allows to configure which fields are to be displayed. Unfortunately, these settings are forgotten the next time you want to create an epic.

*Steps to reproduce*

Note: Our JIRA is configured to require a component for each issue

* click on "create epic" button/link in the planning board
* Fill in Epic name and summary
* select "create"
* you get error message: "Component/s should be modified during this transition."
* select "configure fields", activate "Component/s"
* select "Component"
* click "create"
* click on "create epic" again

*result*
The Component/s field is not displayed

*expected result*
The Component/s field should be always displayed unless I remove it again
fields.summary: Create Epic dialog does not remember which fields should be displayed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Description*
Burndown chart occasionally displays negative remaining values.

*Steps to reproduce*

* Create a story with one task with original estimate of 2h
* start sprint
* move task "in progress"
* log 1h using TEMPO
* log 5h using TEMPO
* Change remaining estimate to 2h using the detail section of the work tab of the greenhopper board
* log 1h using TEMPO

*Result*
The burndown chart temporarily shows -1h remaining:
!chart.PNG|thumbnail!
The burndown detail table incorrectly shows some backdating, which did not happen:
!table.PNG|thumbnail!
It seems to me that Greenhopper somehow things that the last work log happened before the editing of the remaining hours which is not the case.

*Expected result*
No negative remaining values anywhere. No display of backdating. Display correct order of events.
fields.summary: Burndown chart displays negative hours remaining

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Agile project tab in JIRA is reading the information on what's mapped to the To Do/In Progress/Done progress bar from the Classic Task Board not the Agile board.

This can produce a discrepancy when the statuses in the Agile board don't match what configuration of the Task Board (the Agile project tab will show numbers that relate to the Task Board, not the current Agile board).
fields.summary: "Agile" tab in project overview in JIRA is reading To-Do/In Progress/Done statuses from Classic Planning Board, not Agile Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Users would like to be able to order their backlog by priority of issues if that's what the JQL in their filters is set to.
fields.summary: Have backlog respect order by priority in filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create an Agile Board (Kanban or Scrum);
# Replace  _*ORDER BY Rank ASC*_ with another order condition, or remove ranking altogether;
# Refresh the Board to see the changes.

*Expected result:* Issues on Board are sorted using the new setting, with Sub-tasks still displayed under their parents.

*Actual result:* Sub-tasks are grouped separately from their Stories.

!group.png|thumbnail!


+*Workaround:*+ add ranking by the Rank field to the Board Filter - go to _*Configure Board > Filter*_ and click *_Add Rank_*.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks grouping is broken when ranking by Rank is not enabled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When viewing the Scrum Board Version Report the version selector is limited to a single column. If there are more versions that can fit in this single column the older versions cannot be selected.

For example you cannot select all the versions on this report:
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=112&view=reporting&chart=versionReport&version=29794
fields.summary: Unable to select versions in the GH Version Report if there are too many versions to fit on screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After upgrading GreenHopper, many users still need to restart and/or reindex their instances to complete the upgrade process.  Some symptoms  include boards not showing up, agile dropdown button not working, and 'GreenHopper Unavailable' messages in the UI.

The purpose of the ticket is to track this issue and identify the cause.
fields.summary: Restart Required After Upgrading GreenHopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
go to a large board and multiclick the sprint button

these disappear on refresh
fields.summary: Multi-clicking create sprint (when delayed on large board) "creates" duplicate sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This task is a placeholder for communicating change to potential consumers of our REST API.

[~rosie@atlassian.com] please include this in the release notes.
fields.summary: Rename "sprints" REST resource to "sprintquery"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When new users create scrum boards it gets confusing because of the fact that they already have a sprint created and running, or that they cannot use certain issues because they are already in other sprints.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have Scrum boards' filters to be created with the "and Sprint not in openSprints()" filter by default

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a project administrator, I would like to be able to start any sprint and not just the top one

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a project administrator, I would like to be able to reorder planned sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When adding tickets to a sprint, if there is previous work done on the ticket in a specific order, the time added to the sprint is not what is expected. The following is how you can reproduce the issue. 

I suggest that you leave 1-2 mins between each to ensure different time stamps
# Create a new issue
# Log some work on it
# Log some more work on it
# Add it to an active sprint
# Go back and edit the first work log to change the remaining hours
# View the burndown report for the sprint

At this point you'll see that the time that is added to the chart does not align with what you'd expect. 

The last action of logging work should have set the RTE to a specific value. That is the value that is expected when adding the issue to the sprint. If the RTE is changed after adding the issue to a sprint then the RTE change should show on the burndown versus changing the original addition to the sprint.
fields.summary: Rapid Boards do not report burndown as expected with edits to work log

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have a parent jira with a few sub-tasks and each of them are added with an estimate time. In greenhopper detail view, it shows a nice breakdown for remaining estimate but not for the orginal estimates (see my screen shot below). As a comparison, jira view has a flag to include sub-task numbers and when it is on, it shows the total estimated (original) which is more clear.

So I suggest to add a down-arrow to expand the estimate numbers for parent and sub-tasks which will be similar to the remaining estimate right below.
fields.summary: Estimate in detail view for parent jira with sub-tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As of now, only the value that the Board Estimation settings are pointing to that is displayed in the tooltip in the Issue list in Plan Mode. It would be useful for planning/prioritization purposes to be able to display more than one if required. E.g. some teams would want to see both the Time Estimate and Business Value when planning a Sprint.
fields.summary: Ability to display multiple values in the Plan View tooltips

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On classic boards one can edit the card and list view according to ones needs. Thus the important informations of all listed issues can be seen and compared directly in the list.

For the Scrum Boards it is only possible to edit the details of the "Issue Detail View", which only shows the details for one issue at a time. So it is needed to click on each issue to see the important information or switch to the issue navigator. 

Our projects have a fairly large amount of issues per sprint and so it is not practical to click on every issue all the time.

Therefor we need the option to choose the shown issue details for the new agile boards.
fields.summary: Greenhopper Scrum Board - make it possible to edit the shown issue details in plan and work mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would be handy to be able to limit access to Issues within a specific Epic.

+Use case:+ big Projects with separate teams (e.g. contractors) working on Issues in specific Epics that shouldn't be visible to everyone.
fields.summary: Epic-based Issue security

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a project administrator or board owner I need to be able to be able to add/remove Statused by using the "Add Status" button from the board Configuration window.

Currently this button does appear only for jira-administrators.
fields.summary: Agile board "Add Status" button is not available unless you are member of jira-administrators

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In order to meet certain time constraints, having a centralised scrum master for an entire production is beneficial.  He will start one sprint on a common board and then each team will have their own board to work from.  However, with the very large teams we have working at any given time, our project can have sprints upwards of 700-900 issues.  Simply starting or ending these sprints can take an inordinate amount of time.  Frequently the loading screen will simply timeout.
fields.summary: Large Sprints take a very long time to load when Starting or Ending

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Because maybe the user is looking for this?
fields.summary: Suggestion: If we try to create a board by project or filter and there is already such board popup a suggestion that it already exists with a link to it.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: IE - dialogs produce 'false' in body

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
GreenHopper becomes unusable after the upgrade if a Custom Field it uses has no Context configured. Errors could be displayed upon creating new Issues, depending on the field affected.

+Cause:+ upgrade tasks responsible for modifying a Custom Field will fail if that Field doesn't have any Context.
+Fix:+ apply a Context to the Custom Field - GreenHopper should work correctly.
fields.summary: GreenHopper unusable after upgrade if a Custom Field Context is empty

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be good if issues in the board could be show with different background colors based on it's due date: 

- If the current date is greater than 2 days before the due date on an issue, the background of the issue on the Plan/Work board should be white.
- If the current date between 1 and 2 days (inclusive) before the due date on an issue, the background of the issue on the Plan/Work boards should be yellow.
- If the current date is 1 day (inclusive) or less before the due date on an issue, the background of the issue on the Plan/Work boards should be red.
- If the due date field on an issue is blank, the background of the issue on the Plan/Work boards should be white.
fields.summary: Board with priorization of issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: See attached. I'm pretty sure it's because Jira counts subtasks and epics and GH doesn't, but it's definitely confusing to users.
fields.summary: Jira and Greenhopper count issues differently

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Greenhopper allows user to configure custom field in the issue detail view, however all the custom fields in JIRA are shown whether the it's related to the project used in the filter or not.

For example:
# Custom Field B are available to project B only as specified in the field configuration context while Custom Field A are available to project A.
# User had a scrum board with project A only.
# User want to configure custom field A to the board issue detail view.
# However, in the configuration, both Custom Field A and B shown up for selection.

Use Case:
* Imagine a JIRA instance has 100 custom fields and some of them are not associated to the correct project. 
* This will generate a serious confusion and painful process on configure the field to the board.
* Worse case scenario - several fields with same name(some users have such scenario) added to the view. If the wrong field were selected, the value would not shown in the issue detail view.
fields.summary: Issue Detail View configuration should respect custom field configuration context

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When creating an issue, if I select the epic link from the drop-down list of 'Suggested' options without typing anything in the box, it always appears to set the epic to the one below the epic I selected.

However, if I type the first few characters of the epic and then select it from the list, the epic link is set correctly.

I can reproduce this easily on both Firefox and Chrome so it doesn't appear to be a browser issue.
fields.summary: Issues assigned to wrong epic if epic is selected from 'Suggested' list
